'''Acarigua''' ({{IPA-es|akaˈɾiɣwa}}), founded as '''San Miguel de Acarigua''', is a city in northwestern [[Venezuela]], in the northern part of the state of [[Portuguesa (state)|Portuguesa]].
Formerly the state capital, it is a major commercial center for the northern [[Los Llanos, Venezuela|Llanos]] region of [[South America]]. It is contiguous with the neighboring city of [[Araure]].
== Demographics == The city's population was 116,551 in 1990 and was estimated at 208,495 in 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.world-gazetteer.com/wg.php?x=1145571938&men=gpro&lng=en&dat=32&geo=-228&srt=npan&col=aohdq&pt=c&va=&geo=358499080|title=www.world-gazetteer.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120209022818/http://www.world-gazetteer.com/wg.php?x=1145571938&men=gpro&lng=en&dat=32&geo=-228&srt=npan&col=aohdq&pt=c&va=&geo=358499080|archivedate=2012-02-09}}</ref>
== Religion == Its [[Cathedral]] ''Catedral de Nuestra Señora de la Corteza'' is the episcopal see of the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Acarigua–Araure]].

== Ecology ==
===Fauna=== The ''[[Thysania agrippina]]'' is one of the world's largest moths, with wings {{convert|32|cm|in}} in size.
===Flora=== The saman or ''[[Samanea saman]]'' is the most widespread tree throughout the city.
===Protected areas=== * Parque Musiu Carmelo * Parque Mittar Nakichenovich * Balneario Sabanetica * Balneario el Mamón * Parque Curpa, popularly known as José Antonio Páez Park.
==Notable people== * [[Luis Herrera Campins|Luis Antonio Herrera Campins]] (1925-2007), was President of Venezuela<ref>''Gaceta Oficial de Venezuela'', period 1979-1984.</ref>
== Media == Acarigua is home to [[List of newspapers in Venezuela#Portuguesa State|3 regional newspapers]], and the community TV station [[Siguaraya TV]].
== Transport == Acarigua is served by the [[Oswaldo Guevara Mujica Airport]].
== Sports == It is home to [[Portuguesa FC]], whose home stadium is the [[Estadio General José Antonio Paez]].
== See also == * [[Araure]] *[[2019 Portuguesa, Venezuela prison uprising]]
